section.title: Login Process
section.para: When you run penify login, the tool:

listitem.para: Opens your default web browser
Redirects you to Penify's login page
Captures the authentication token after successful login
Saves the token in ~/.penify file

section.title: API Token Storage
section.para: API tokens are stored in your home directory in the .penify file. This JSON file contains:

listitem.para: Environment variable PENIFY_API_TOKEN (highest priority)
Token in ~/.penify file

literallayout.computeroutput: penify ├── commit Generate smart commit messages ├── config Configure local LLM and JIRA │ ├── llm Configure local LLM settings │ └── jira Configure JIRA integration ├── login Log in to Penify account └── docgen Generate code documentation ├── install-hook Install Git post-commit hook └── uninstall-hook Remove Git post-commit hook

section.title: Commit Message Generation
section.para: The commit command analyzes your staged changes and generates meaningful commit messages. It can:

listitem.para: Use a local LLM if configured
Enhance messages with JIRA issue details
Provide both title and description

section.para: For specific options and examples, see docs/commit-commands.md.

section.title: Code Documentation Generation
section.para: The docgen command generates documentation for your code:

listitem.para: Current Git Diff: Default behavior, documents only changed files
Specific File: Pass a file path with -l path/to/file.py
Entire Folder: Pass a folder path with -l path/to/folder

section.title: Authentication Requirement
section.para: This feature requires authentication with a Penify account. Run penify login before using documentation features.

section.title: Configuration Settings
section.para: Configure local settings using the config command:

listitem.para: LLM Settings: Configure a local LLM for commit message generation
JIRA Settings: Set up JIRA integration for enhanced commit messages

section.para: For detailed configuration options, see docs/config-commands.md.

section.title: Git Hooks
section.para: Penify can install Git hooks to automate documentation generation:

listitem.para: Install: penify docgen install-hook
What it does: Automatically generates documentation for changed files after each commit
Uninstall: penify docgen uninstall-hook

section.title: Custom Hook Location
section.para: You can specify a custom location for Git hooks:

listitem.para: Set PENIFY_API_TOKEN as an environment variable
Run commands without requiring interactive login

section.title: Remote Repository Documentation
section.para: Generate documentation for an entire repository:

literallayout.computeroutput: git clone https://github.com/user/repo cd repo penify docgen -l .

listitem.para: API Key Errors: Ensure you've run penify login or set PENIFY_API_TOKEN
LLM Configuration: Check your LLM settings with cat ~/.penify
JIRA Integration: Verify JIRA credentials in your configuration
